inn1.comm: he finds good shape back in towards Parthiv straight away, the diminutive left-hander getting back and across to defend his first ball

confident start! Just the one sighter for Parthiv, who rocks back and pulls the second delivery in the air to deep midwicket ... It's chased all the way to the boundary, and Ben Stokes does really well to claw it back just before the rope
a better length from Anderson, but as the ball curls from off to leg the line is a little off and they pick up a single off the bat/pad to fine leg
this one doesn't swing, and then line takes it down past leg stump. Wide called
Anderson teases Rahane outside off with an outswinger but, mindful of his dismissal in the last match, Rahane lets it go
Anderson is a little off here, again he hurls one down leg as the ball doesn't swing. Is the slope messing with his rhythm?
the mixed bag continues, as he follows that up with another good outswinger outside off. Rahane almost has a fiddle at it, but opts to leave
tucked off the hip, the ball rolling behind square, and Rahane is off the mark
a decent start, the ball rising quite sharply off a length. Rahane raises his arms high to leave
great line, great length. Finn sends the ball in on the angle, Rahane plays the line and is beaten as it hits the seam and leaves him
an uncharacteristically tentative defensive poke from Rahane, the ball taking the inner half of the bat and rolling back down the track
good wheels from Finn as he aims one full and straight. Dug out just wide of mid on
Rahane looks to drive on the up, and ends up slicing it down to third man. Finn has his hands in the air as the ball doesn't go to hand
slanted across the left-hander, who steps across to cover his off stump and leaves alone
beaten by the outswinger! Anderson draws Rahane forward and curls the ball past his outside edge
this one hits the seam and holds its line, Rahane defending to leg
perhaps just a little short of a good length, Rahane staying deep in his crease
Anderson targets the pads, Rahane nudging to square leg
a little fuller, outside off, defended
Anderson ends a good second over with another length delivery that is turned to square leg. A maiden
past the outside edge! Bounce and carry from Finn, and Parthiv plays and misses outside off, stepping half forward
pushed down the leg side, Parthiv shuffling across to let it pass
probing delivery on middle and off, the ball taking the inside edge of a hurried defensive push
good pace from Finn, but the line is wide enough outside off for Parthiv to safely leave alone
the bowler straightens up and Parthiv nurdles to straight midwicket
this is quality new ball bowling from Finn, who is working up a good head of steam and generally maintaining a strict line. Parthiv guides this one to gully, playing a little away from the body
and a tight finish to the over, Finn giving Parthiv nothing to work with as the final delivery is defended back down the track
snaking gently away through the air as Rahane gets onto the front foot to defend
forced, on the up, to cover
Rahane looks for the drop-and-run single to cover point, but the fielder is in too quickly
pitched right up outside off, Rahane hanging is bat out to limply drive back to the bowler
Rahane presses well forward, the ball hitting the seam and coming in to him as the ball is squirted defensively to leg
clipped just wide of midwicket, and they charge through for one
Finn thunders to the crease and hurls down a low full toss just outside off, Rahane - perhaps taken a little by surprise - can only tap it to mid-off
leading edge! Finn's pace, bounce and movement got the better of Rahane as he looked to turn the ball into the leg side. Fortunately for the batsman, the ball looped safely up and over gully
aggressive from Rahane! But the execution is lacking, as he charges out at the bowler and flails wildly towards leg, the ball fizzing past the outside edge
another big shot from Rahane as Finn pitches up on middle and leg, the ball flying down to fine leg
good running as Parthiv drops the ball in close and they set off immediately
Finn is looking really threatening here, as now he finds the outside edge of a forward press, the ball flying through a vacant fourth slip and down to third man
Anderson hits a good length, Rahane defends
nicely bowled again from Anderson, this one jagging in to the right-hander to strike him on the pad. Parthiv senses the chance for a quick single off the pad, and calls straight away
shot! Parthiv plays the pick-up pull really well, lifting this off a length and in front of square on the leg side. The ball lands just over the boundary marker, so that's six
good response from Anderson! This one bursts off the seam past Parthiv's outside edge

top-edged! But it rockets up and over Kieswetter and bounces down to the boundary. He was looking for that pick-up shot again, but the length wasn't quite there this time. India are looking to push on after a quiet start
great lines once more from Anderson. Parthiv isn't quite sure whether to come forward or back, and is beaten swishing outside off
Rahane's quiet start continues, as this is nudged into the leg side
Rahane is starting to look a little fidgety out there, he's searching for a calming boundary. This is pulled off the front foot, the ball going straight to mid-on
edged! Neither slip nor keeper go for it as the ball flies right between them. Well, Finn is in the midst of a penetrative spell but he's not getting his just rewards
Finn hurls this down with vim and vigour on a good length, the ball hitting the seam and spitting in towards Rahane's midriff
beaten outside off! Finn is really making a statement with this spell, beating Rahane's outside edge
nothing wrong with the ball, but that's a fantastic shot from Rahane, who seizes on the hint of width and punches powerfully through cover point
Anderson pitches up, searching for swing, and Parthiv drives to mid-on
flashing outside off! This was shorter and a little wider from Anderson. Parthiv attempted to make the most of it, but couldn't find the connection
driven just wide of mid-off, and there's just enough time for a scampered single

clipped off the toes through square leg, and they push hard for the second. Hmm, perhaps a little too hard, as Parthiv is stepping a little gingerly after tumbling over at the non-striker's end. He seems to be ok.
Anderson continues to keep Rahane quiet, as the ball is tapped to a fielder
full and quite wide, inviting the drive. Rahane lays into it, coming forward, but picks out the cover fielder with precision
a yorker is speared down just outside off at good pace, Parthiv opening the face on the bat as he digs it out

leading edge again! Finn is finding really disconcerting bounce off a great length. Parthiv was looking to turn this one to midwicket but it went in the opposite direction and - fortunately for him - dropped short of the point fielder
a splice-jarring delivery is fended into the leg side, Rahane taking the bottom hand off the bat as he looks to protect his ribs

Wild. Rahane is looking rattled out there. Another Finn lifter bursts past the outside edge as Rahane aims an almighty heave to leg, and Finn jogs down the wicket to let Rahane know exactly what he thinks of the stroke
fuller and straighter from Finn, Rahane gives himself a little room and tries to manufacture a drive, the ball taking the inside half of the bat and rolling into space on the leg side

great finish from Finn. He's bowling with superb rhythm, the left-hand/right-hand combination doing nothing to upset him. This one really zings off the good length, beating the outside edge of Parthiv's forward poke
decent start from him. Perhaps a touch short of a good length, but it cramps Rahane for room as he defends to leg

flicked with balance and poise! Rahane has finally found the middle of the bat, and tellingly it's with a shot that he didn't try to over-hit at all. He just leaned over this leg-stump half volley, turning his wrists on the ball to send the ball racing to square leg
Bresnan tightens his line and is defended
full, the line outside off stump, and Rahane comes forward to push to cover
yet another leading edge! Rahane had set himself to crack this into the leg side, but the ball seamed and bounced away from him, looping over the vacant slip area and bouncing down to third man
Parthiv looks to be aggressive, walking down at Bresnan, but the bowler re-adjusts well and there's no run to be had
seam, bounce and pace are too much for Rahane as the ball fizzes past a defensive push and strikes him on the body
once again Finn finds sharp movement back in off the pitch, the ball stinging Rahane on the left thigh

a top edged scoop flies for six! Rahane didn't look in control of this at all. He was trying to pull the ball up and over square leg, but seemed to have got more height than distance in the shot. Nevertheless, it carries all the way!

well, we've praised Rahane for the purity of his strokeplay in this series, but he's playing some agricultural shots at the moment. This is fetched off the stumps and creamed through sqaure leg, the bat swinging right across the line
and another! Rahane charges Finn and heaves, the ball taking the edge and flying over the slip to third man. India's supporters don't mind that at all, and happily cheer the runs
again Rahane jumps out, but this is short from Finn and rises up and over his attempted uppercut. Finn extends his follow through down the wicket, giving Rahane a right earful
Parthiv has been fairly anonymous after his fluent start, tapping this quietly off his legs for a single
Bresnan hits a length outside off, Rahane opening the face to guide the ball to third man
Bresnan has quickly settled into a rhythm, zoning in on off stump to keep Parthiv quiet
slapped! Parthiv won't be kept quiet for long, stepping down the wicket and seizing on a short delivery, an explosive pull arcing away in front of square. Great shot
flashed behind square on the off side as Bresnan offers width, third man sprinting round to cut it off
full and straight to end the over, Rahane digging it out to cover
Broad is full to start, Parthiv's flat-footed drive going to mid-off
guided down to third man, an easy single taken

gone! Broad strikes in his first over. He aimed for a surprise yorker, and Rahane played over the top of what turned out to be a low, dipping full toss. Broad appeals, the umpire's finger quickly goes up. Strangely, Rahane never really looked comfortable in this innings.
Dravid is tested first ball as yet again Broad is very full and straight, but he does enough to dig it out to mid-on
on a length outside off, Dravid stepping across and leaving alone
left alone outside off once more
chipped in the air, but wide of a leaping midwicket fielder and he connected well enough to pick up a boundary
Parthiv is up on one leg to whip a pull out into the deep. He seems to be moving alright at the crease
Dravid comes well forward with bat and pad together in defence
good length from Bresnan again, Dravid is forward to defend once more
just a little width offered outside off, but Dravid is new to the crease and looks to guide the ball through gully. No run on offer
the veteran batsman comes nicely forward again, defending with the straightest of bats and a high left elbow
full of length from Broad, Parthiv defending off middle

Broad strikes again! Parthiv had profited from the pull shot in this innings, but it has now led to his dismissal. This wasn't quite short enough for the shot, but he went through with it, looking to mow the ball in the air over midwicket. Bopara got himself underneath the swirling chance, tumbling to the ground as he took the chance
very full outside off to start with, left alone
comes in from a length, Virat is forward and across and blocks
nothing push really, really feeble, there was some noise as the length ball passed the bat, England go up in unison, the sound was bat hitting pad
fine way to get off the mark, a touch widish and fuller outside off, Virat leans forward and squeezes the drive through point
presses forward and opens the face to get this one to point
crashed hard by Dravid but straight to point, now then
trickles in to the leg side off the pads
inside edge as Virat shuffles across to a length ball angled in, gets it towards square leg, and the single is on
width, short of a length, sitting up, Dravid gets on top of the bounce, and finds cover with the cut
gets front foot across and opens the face late to send this one from close to off to third man to get off the mark
clipped off the pads wide of midwicket, they manage only a single though
tight line close to off stump, Virat goes back to block it back
gets forward and tries to open the face, runs it straight to backward point
there was some extra bounce on this one around off stump, Virat is surprised as he comes forward to defend it and jabs it away in the end
fullish, but towards the pads and tucked towards midwicket
stays in the crease beside the line and tries to guide one with an open face, finds the man at point
stifled shout as Virat is hit on the pad, comes forward and across but Bresnan has got this one to nip back in sharply, struck outside the line though
bounce now from a length outside off, Virat sees it early and shoulders arms
gets across and turns a length ball in front of midwicket for a sharpish single
arches back, gets on top of the bounce and glides it elegantly, straight to point, oh well
all that middling and finding the field makes him go hard at one too close for the cut, chops it in to the ground and hustles across for the single
reaches out across to one a touch widish outside off, pushes firmly but cannot get it wide of cover
gets front leg out of the way and squeezes the drive off the full delivery,  mid on in in the way though
that will go, Broad goes short of a length, Dravid arches back and pings the gap between cover and extra cover off the middle of the bat, not more than a caress really
turns this one on the leg side, cannot get it past midwicket
looks to get forward and hit a full one with the angle on the leg side,  gets it off the inner half of the blade towards midwicket
opens the face and runs a length ball outside off to point
Virat plonks this one in front of point and takes off for the single, there isn't any to be had, and he has to scurry back

that is delicate, that is late and that will find the fine third man boundary, stays beside the line to one ending on off stump, and opens the face to run it past the keeper, third man puts in the dive, in vain
Bopara goes for another boundary, shortish and wide outside off, Dravid arches back and creams the cut, no chance for point, that flew, for once in to the gap
doesn't get hold of this one, turns a fullish one speared in on the leg side
leans forward and pushes for a single past extra cover
drops-and-runs, the single is not there, Virat scampers back as point gets to the ball
squeezed out towards point from the crease, tidy finish from Bopara
steered to third man for a single
not much room to tuck with any sort of timing on the leg side as he shuffles across, plays it down softly
gets it to hold the line outside off stump as it bounces, Virat hangs the bat out and gets it past the lone slip to third man
sends it wide down leg with some inward movement from back of a length
straightish and full on middle and leg, Virat is not really getting forward and plays it out to midwicket
finds the gap this time and brings up the 100 with a purposeful punch to sweeper cover
tight delivery close to off stump, rising a tad as Rahul opens the face and gets it to point
pushes hard but only as far as mid on as Bopara keeps it within the stumps
short of a length, ending on leg, Virat shuffles and whips it wide of the man at long leg
ending on off stump this time at 128.8 kph, good length too, Virat pushes it back to the bowler
tries to turn this one from around off but gets it straight to mid on
well done now, stays on the crease, allows it to come in with the angle, and takes it from off stump to guide it past backward point
well forward to the pitch and driving hard, everything right, straight to mid off though
straight on middle stump, as tight as it gets, Virat pushes it straight back
gets forward and pushes but finds mid on
banged short, but wide down the leg side
sends another one down the leg side now, off a fuller length this time
inside edge as he gets the line right this time, there is a direct hit from Bopara but Virat's big dive has saved him
that's a getaway, Dravid going for a pull to a ball that wasn't short enough, inside edge almost crashes in to the stumps
he is wandering down the track now, a rarity this from Rahul, but Broad beats him with one dug in short that moves away past the outside edge
confusion, Virat is eager for the run as Rahul cuts towards cover, and has to get back in time as his partner isn't up for the dash
the safest single now, with a push off the front foot to sweeper cover
width outside off stump, he goes for the cut, doesn't get hold of it, but enough bat and timing on it to get it down to sweeper cover

Anderson is sure as he shouts out an appeal, Virat hit on the pads as he shuffles across and tries to work on the leg side, misses and is hit high on the pads, umpire Erasmus is unmoved, replays show that ball would have clipped top of leg
tight line, back of a length, pushed back to the bowler
goes for the drive as he sees this one pitched up, cannot beat extra cover
gets bat in front of pad as he flicks a length ball in front of square leg
right on target, flight close to off, full length, turned to midwicket

Swann strikes, off his second ball, loose from Virat, trying to dab late against the turn, and gets the edge through to the keeper, Swann tossing it up on a length, and found some extra bounce which ultimately did Virat in
gets forward to a flighted ball from round the stumps, and pushes to long off
gets across and whips a turning ball to midwicket from the crease

and that is the end of Rahul as well, two in the over for Swann, tosses it up very full, Rahul pushes in the air from the crease, and the ball carries to Swann who takes a sharp low catch tumbling forward, trouble for India
pushes forward and turns a fullish one to midwicket, what a first over from Swann
has him hopping in the crease to defend one going across him from short of a length, it bounces too much for his comfort, and he brings it down off an inside edge
bouncing again from short of a length, not at all unpredictable from Anderson, Raina hops and manages to keep it down
not as short this time and tucked in front of square leg
well left outside off as Anderson gets the angle going from a length
short of a length on the pads and tucked backward of square leg
Dhoni shuffles across and outside the off stump, and lets go a straight delivery a foot away from him
tossed up from round the stumps, Raina gets the single to long off with a firm push
lunges at a fuller one with the bat and turns it past Raina to long on
pushes forward and gets the single towards sweeper cover as the man in the circle cannot stop it
allowing it to turn in from a length and slapping it through point
drives with the turn down to long off
gets forward and smothers a fullish one turning in
getting it to move in a bit from a length on middle, squeezed back down the track
hops in the air and works a bouncing delivery in front of square leg
comes walking down the track and works for a single from around off to midwicket
getting across and behind the line of a rising shortish one, defends it solidly
eep, he has shuffled across and tried to get on top of the short ball angled across, but in the end plays an awkward cross-batted slap in front of square leg
straight outside off and Dhoni flags it though
gets to the pitch of a tossed up fuller one and squeezes the push past short extra cover
pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
confusion as Dhoni tucks with the turn in front of midwicket and comes down for the run, makes it back in the end
fuller one whipped down the track
very full on middle, dug back along the pitch
another very full delivery, he whip-drives down to long off
Bresnan gets some bounce outside off stump, Dhoni lets it go right away
Dhoni has a go at one a touch wide outside off, does not get anything on it
not much width this time, fuller length too, turned to midwicket
shuffling across and solidly behind the line of a length ball, defended towards short extra cover
pushes with an open face to point, no option but to play quietly for some time
Bresnan puts in more effort and gets it to bounce outside off, Dhoni has a look and lets it go
pushes in front of point, looks for the single, isn't getting it
tight line fullish on off stump, Raina gets forward to defend
pushes firmly at a flighted one, straight to short extra cover
Swann getting through some tight overs, another one on off defended off the front foot
squeezed towards point with an open face
well bowled, slows it up, tosses it around middle and off, Raina smothers it in forward defence
the loosener is hurled down outside off, Dhoni stepping across to leave alone
Dhoni pushes one past backward point, on the walk, and they push hard for the second

edged! No slip in place, Kieswetter leaps to his left but he can't even get a glove to it. Still no luck for Finn, who is still finding movement off the surface with this older ball. Dhoni was late coming forward to this full delivery, and the edge would've landed in first slip's lap
this went like a legcutter from Finn, seaming sharply away off a short-ish length to zip past Dhoni's outside edge
a touch straighter from Finn, and Dhoni is able to work him into the leg side for one
slanted across Raina, who covers his off stump and shoulders arms
Dhoni hops out of his crease but Swann spots him coming and adjusts his length. The ball is nudged to square leg, and there's no run to be had
pushed down the ground for an ambled single
the left-hander skips down at the offspinner, but can only dig a very full ball back to the bowler
the floater from Swann, it hangs in the air for an age before pitching and spinning away, Raina picking up a single with a nurdle to cover
and he follows that up with a much quicker one, Dhoni rushing his defence to keep the arm ball out
the bottom hand comes into the stroke as Dhoni looks to push to leg, but midwicket is quickly round to cut it off
Raina backs away as Finn thunders to the crease, looking to open up the off side. The bowler follows him, but he finds a single to cover
probing stuff from Finn, who seams one off a length to take the inside edge of Dhoni's tentative forward push
nicely full once more, this one a little wider of off as Dhoni gets forward and across to drive softly to extra cover
Dhoni spots the chance for a quick single as the ball takes the inside half of a defensive bat and rolls just wide of midwicket. Quick calling, fast running. But still no boundaries
rising off a length, Raina gets across to off and clips off the hip to long leg. The placement is good, and they rush back for the second
there's a hint of top edge on the cut as the ball flies down to third man, but no major drama
tossed up on off stump, Raina edging onto the front foot to drive to long off
Dhoni bends into a strong sweep, making sure to roll the wrists and keep the ball down, but picks out the man at square leg
bat, pad and a looping chance ... but there's no-one close enough on the leg side, and the ball drops in front of square leg
worked into the leg side for one
Raina uses his feet to get to the pitch, chipping back up and over Swann's head
full and straight from Swann, and Raina flicks off the toes to straight midwicket
Raina looks to be aggressive, slapping a length delivery back at Finn, the bowler stopping it in his follow through
Raina angles the ball towards gully with a hop

hoicked out to deep midwicket! Raina held nothing back as he flung himself into the stroke, but didn't get the greatest connection. Still, he did enough to find the boundary despite Trott's diving effort, and break the shackles somewhat
shot! Again there's not much culture in the stroke, Raina clearing the left leg and slicing the drive through cover, but this one was out of the middle and threaded the the off side field
well, this wasn't too far away from the leg stump. Raina got right across to off stump and tried to glance it fine, but the ball just bounced on him and went over leg stump.
good response from Finn after the boundaries, digging this one in on middle and off. Raina gave himself room for the uppercut, but didn't get a touch on it
both batsmen on the attack now! This has sailed into the crowd beyond wide long on, Dhoni having stepped down the track and sent the ball arcing away with a full swing of the bat
good batting from India's captain, who follows up the big shot with a quick single
speared at the pads, Raina working to leg but finding the fielder
tossed right up on off stump, really slow through the air. Raina comes forward and places it to cover
more tip-and-run cricket from Dhoni, who calls straight away for one as the ball rolls into the off side
cracked out into the deep on the off side, the sweeper hurling the ball back in
close! Tapped to mid-off, they set off for a quick single but Anderson swoops and shies. The throw goes just wide of the stumps as Raina dives to make his ground
on a length and straight. Dhoni stands at the crease and taps it back down the track
again Dhoni waits in his crease, this time working the ball into the leg side
Broad was perhaps aiming for the surprise yorker, but the delivery slips out as a gentle full toss that is driven to long on to take this partnership to 50
Raina times a drive back down the pitch, but the ball strikes Broad on the foot in his follow through, so just the one run
flicked wristily to backward point
Swann jogs in round the stumps, twirling one down outside off, and Raina drives to long off
Swann errs in line with a quicker one, arrowing this one down leg. Kieswetter had no chance
good, quick calling between these two. The ball was clipped to midwicket and they set off straight away
this one went straight on with the arm as Raina played back, but he read it off the pitch and found a single to midwicket
Dhoni comes forward with bat and pad together, nudging a single to point
Raina is almost done by the flight, taking one hand off the bat as he drives to extra cover
nicely tossed up by Swann again, this time Raina gets it down to long off
canny slower one from Broad! Raina didn't quite read it and was beaten on the outside edge as he came forward and pushed at it
Raina swings across the line at a full one, but the connection isn't great so it's just the one run
great fielding from Cook at mid-off! Broad was full once again and Dhoni drilled a drive down the ground, but Cook sprinted across and dived to get a palm to it
deft touch! Raina has tried this shot a few times in this innings without success, but now he's got bat on an uppercut and collects four runs back over Kieswetter's head
Raina slams the drive to mid-off, and there's just enough time for a quick single
a length delivery is flat-batted down to long-on, and they rush through for two before the stumps are broken
good start, on a length and straight as Raina tucks to leg
slower ball from Anderson, but it's picked and worked into space for one
another slower one - much slower - and Dhoni cracks the looping full toss out to deep cover.
Anderson quickens up, Raina drives to long off
tapped to cover, and the call for a single is immediate
another slower one from Anderson, Raina clipping off his toes to square leg
tight start from Bresnan, firing one at the blockhole. Raina digs it out to deep mid-off
again Bresnan targets the yorker, and the resultant low full toss tails in a touch as Dhoni glances to leg
slower ball now, but it's lobbed harmlessly down the leg side
that's better from Bresnan, but Raina still finds enough space on the off side for a quick single
bunted down to long off with minimum fuss, Bresnan still keeping the ball full
there's the change-up, this one is dug in short and takes Raina a little by surprise, the ball getting big on him as he tries to pull
very full on leg stump, Raina flicks and they push for the second run
a huge hit flies miles in the air ... but has he got the distance on it? There are men out at deep midwicket and long-on, but the ball bounces right between them and bounces over the rope for four!
four more! Short and wide outside off, Dhoni finds the gap with a scything cut and there's no-one out on the off side boundary to stop that
Anderson finds a straighter line and bowls this one a little shorter, Dhoni hopping back and dinking to cover for a frantic single

that is massive! Right in the slot for Raina, Anderson dishing up a friendly leg stump half volley. Still, it had to be hit and Raina sent it sailing into the third tier of the stands with a powerful pick-up off the legs
Raina attempts to repeat the shot but can't pull it off a second time, but they scamper through for a quick leg bye
Anderson's frailty at the death is being exposed here, as he sprints in and then hurls the ball down the leg side to be called wide. He looks just a little rattled
a tip-and-run single to cover ends the over
Dhoni perhaps just tried to hit this full one a little too hard, the ball taking the inside edge and ricocheting off his pad
another very full delivery outside off from Bresnan, practically the yorker, and Dhoni digs it out to mid-off
a low, dipping full toss is swiped out into the leg side
Bresnan is zoning in on a really good length here, as another yorker is dug out back to the bowler ... but he parries the ball away in his follow through, allowing a single
timing! There was nothing wrong with the delivery really, but Dhoni picked the perfect spot to hit it, sending the ball to deep midwicket with plenty of wrist
good end to the over for the bowler, who zings down a yorker wide of off. It's close, but not called wide
Raina loses his shape completely as he throws everything into the shot, but is rewarded with runs as the drive is chipped up and over mid-off
a yorker outside off slips under the bat as Raina attempts to angle it to third man
huge! Broad hurled down a slower offcutter on a very hittable length, and Raina absolutely creamed it into the second tier of the stands beyond midwicket
that's a much better length from Broad, and Raina digs the yorker out to cover
ah, this could have been another boundary! An attempted yorker slipped out as a friendly full toss outside leg, but Raina found the fine leg fielder with a paddle behind his legs
chipped, inside out, over wide long-off, but the ball plugs in the outfield. Dhoni wanted a third run there, Raina didn't, and the junior batsman is getting a reprimand
Raina is giving it a great thwack here, again he finds the boundary with a powerful heave into the leg side. There are two men out in the deep, but he put it right between them
again Raina targets the leg side, but this time it's straight to the fielder
arrowed down well wide of off, and that's clearly wide
Dhoni joins Raina in reaching fifty! He got there by intentionally slicing a full toss up and over backward point, there's no fielder out there and the ball rolls over the rope
much better yorker from Bresnan. but there's still a single to be had as Dhoni digs it out into the leg side
Bresnan attempts to sucker Raina with the slower-ball bouncer, but the batsman spots it and pulls in the air down to long leg
punched to deep mid-off for one to end the powerplay - 58 runs from it
Raina immediately reacts with aggression, skipping down the track and driving to long-on
an almighty swipe to leg is missed, the arm ball thudding into Kieswetter's gloves
this time he connects! The ball flies over deep midwicket, the forearms adding real power to the stroke
another mow from Dhoni, and more runs, the ball dispatched to wide long-on
helicopter shot! It's well connected, but he finds the fielder in the deep
again Dhoni targets the leg side, but can pick up only a single as his pull meets a fielder
Dhoni tried to smear the covers off the ball with this shot, scything through the line at a full one, his left leg raised. Just the single however, the ball going to long-off
full again from Anderson, a slower one and Dhoni angles his bat to get the ball through gully
Raina follows suit, jabbing down on a yorker outside off to pick up a single to third man
Anderson continues what has been a surprisingly steady over by sending down a pinpoint yorker, just the one run as Dhoni digs it out
Anderson comes round the wicket to change the angle, but then offers Raina a high full toss outside off that is gleefully slapped over backward point for four

shot! Raina keeps his right elbow high as he drives in the air and down the ground. Bresnan charges round from long-off and does well to get to it, but then palms the ball over the boundary. Jimmy is fuming.
home run! That's out of here. Broad flung down a full toss and Dhoni was ready waiting for it, sending the ball flying into a sunny late summer sky with plenty of bottom hand. Hammered.
full, wide and dug out past point
good start from a man who wouldn't have been expecting to bowl. The ball was nicely full and Raina slapped it down the ground, the batsmen pushing hard for the second run

what a catch from Stokes! Raina chipped a drive inside out over cover, the ball pinging right out of the middle. Stokes initially moved to his left, looking to protect the boundary, but then sensed that it was a catchable chance and sprinted forward, diving to hold the ball inches from the turf. Finn finally finds some reward!
Dhoni tries to make the most of a yorker, swinging it to leg, but he finds a fielder and turns down the single, believing he's the one most likely to find a boundary from the last ball
helicopter shot to end the innings, but it flies down to long-on and they can only get a single

inn2.comm: gentle length delivery on middle to start off, Cook tickled it wide of midwicket, mid on fumbles with the dive and they take two
moves away sharply from just around back of a length, Cook stays in the crease and pushes to point
PK is on target this time, floating it up for the drive fullish outside off, Cook pushes at it without moving his feet, and is beaten as the ball moves away a shade
more away movement from the left-hander, this time Cook is ready and lets it go
tight line, ending just outside off, Cook gets forward and pushes to extra cover
well left, PK has settled on a probing line outside that off stump, finding some away shape with the new ball, Cook is wise to it and flags it through
finds lots of bounce from a length, not far from off stump, good judgement from Kieswetter as he lets it go
more bounce, this time with the angle going across the right hander outside off, left alone
starts to come in after pitching back of a length, he went at it with an angled blade and the inside edge went backward of square leg
just short of a length on off, punched to extra cover
RP goes horribly wrong with the line, and sends it way down leg giving Dhoni some grief as it bounds off the glove
right on off stump, they take on extra cover and just make it in the end, Virat dived forward and lobbed the ball, direct hit would have been close
Virat saves some runs with a dive to his left at extra cover, Cook had middled this away going length ball off the front foot
back of a length on the stumps, tucked away through square leg
this one sits up outside off, Cook sees width and latches on to it, hammering it off the back foot past cover
leading edge, falls short of backward point, Cook looking to tuck one off the pads on the leg side, it moved to take the edge
straightish one played towards midwicket
very full on the stumps at 130.1 kph, Cook tries to clip it but finds midwicket again
nothing to work with on this one, ending just outside off on a length, Cook tries to force it down the ground, mistimes it
uses the angle going across him, gets forward and pushes in the gap between extra cover and mid off, Jadeja stops it with the slide, it trickles away, he puts in another one to haul it back in
tight line angled in to Cook who forces it back down the track
now Cook uses the angle in to him, gets across and whips in front of square leg
this one will go, on the pads, there is a man at widish leg slip, no one at long leg, and once the flick beats that man, there is no stopping the boundary
138 kph length ball from RP on the stumps, forces him to play a tight forward defensive

India have got Kieswetter, he comes down the track looking for the big carve over mid off, the ball bounces a touch more as RP bangs it short of a length and he gets it off the outer half high in the air over the infield, gravity took an age in working over it but Jadeja runs back from extra cover and settles under it very well
length ball around off stump pushed down the track
straight delivery outside off and he lets it go
Trott punches without much power or timing and mid on cuts it off
off the mark with a work between mid on and midwicket
fuller length outside off, not much width but Cook goes after it, and times it past those men close-in and it beats the chasing extra cover
punched away wide of extra cover but there is a man sweeping on the boundary

oh dear me, Cook has hit this one straight to extra cover, he won't like to see that replay, length ball sitting up, some extra bounce but nothing alarming, Cook goes at it a touch half-heartedly and spoons it to extra cover, RP takes off, he is delighted
stays in the crease and chops an angled delivery to third man
gets across to one going across, a bit too much, and mistimes the off drive back to RP
there is still no long leg, and the inside edge has raced fine to that boundary, Trott going nowhere with the feet and looking to push one slanted across
well done, Trott shuffles and whips a back of a length ball off middle, gets it in front of square leg in the air, that's enough
beaten on the cut as RP drags this one across him widish outside off
pushes solidly from the crease to short extra cover
testing line close to off as always from PK, pushed away towards short extra cover
walks down the track, PK sees that and drops it a touch short, it moves away as well, Bell opens the face and runs it to backward point
can't get it away, punches off the back foot straight to extra cover, PK not offering any width
ending on the pads with the angle and Bell works it wide of long leg for a couple
moving away from short of a length, he punches without much timing to cover
starts off on a length outside off, pushed away off the front foot to extra cover
steady line outside off stump, pushed past short cover for a single
lovely delivery, Munaf bangs it short of a length, gets it to shape away and beats the push from Bell
walks down the track and outside off, Munaf gets it to rise from short of a length, Bell has to defend
gets hold of it now, and splits the gap between cover and extra cover with an on the up slap-drive, just some width and he capitalised
goes fullish on the stumps, he mistimes the drive down the ground towards mid on
this is fine bowling, some away shape from outside off, he goes after it with an angled bat and is beaten
now he walks down the track to work PK on the leg side, is hit high on the pad, PK thinks that it is worth an appeal
solid forward defence towards cover to one inches from off stump
straightish one on middle and off, but he cannot put it away, whips it straight to midwicket
this could have gone away as well, width from a length outside off, but Trott slaps it to extra cover
well bowled, nipping in late from just outside off, he manages to push it in front of mid on and they get through for the run
bounce for Munaf just outside off, but he has played this well, staying beside the line and chopping it late to third man
Munaf has started off well in this over, nipping away late from a fullish length, he blocks it tightly
just past the man at shortish midwicket, Bell chipping down the track, Munaf getting it to bounce, and the nudge flew just past the fielder

that has raced to the third man boundary, Trott going after a widish one outside off, there is a wide slip in place, he is much too wide to be near this one though as it flies between him and the keeper
tighter delivery, on the stumps, pushed back down the track
solid push off the front foot but that off side infield is swarming with men, cover gets behind this one
short delivery and Bell goes for the pull, does not quite get hold if it and squirts it over midwicket, seemed to stop on him a touch
some bounce now for PK, punched off the back foot towards mid off
dispatched with disdain, sitting up from back of a length, Trott winds up and whips it in powerfully front of square leg
well played, this one took off from a length, he was surprised and even as he arched back he managed to steer it to third man
tries to make some room and open the face, but cannot time it wide of point
on the pads and happily clipped through midwicket
opens the face and steers from close to the body despite the sharp bounce, but Rahul is there at widish slip and puts in the dive to stop it
lots of width this time as he walks across and outside the crease, steered to third man
takes on midwicket with a nudge, Rahane gets quickly to the ball with a dive and lets go of it, but quite weakly in the end and no harm done
runs down this length ball outside off to third man, some rhythm returning to the England innings now
pitched up delivery, he drives neatly off the front foot but finds mid off in the way
smartly done, plants front foot across, gets bat down in front and works it in front of square leg

Trott is gone, PK gets some reward for being around that off stump always, Trott trying to create some pace on the pull, the length was not at all short, and the inside edge has done the damage as it clatters in to the stumps
off the mark with a whiplash guide past point, third man has some work to do
solidly forward in defence to a length ball close to off stump
drawing him forward with a fullish length outside off and leaving him as he has a push inside the line
still better, bangs it in back of a length, and gets it to zip away sharply, the line was on off this time and Bopara had to push at it, beaten again
no long leg, PK goes on the pads, and the clip is worked wide enough of Munaf running around from deep square leg
they are getting in to some bother outside off stump, now Bell is beaten as he tries to cut one that is not short enough, and also bounces too much
well done, bowled much fuller and right on off stump, pushed towards mid on
down the track now, and Munaf drops it short, so Bell can only jab it away on the off side
some width this time and he smacks it off the front foot to sweeper cover
Bopara brings out the pull now to a shortish one, does not time it well enough and it rolls to midwicket
jeez, another play-and-miss outside the off stump, Bopara looking to blaze through cover off the back foot, Munaf getting some extra bounce and beats him
that should have gone, but Bell was a touch late forward to a length ball sitting up, and extra cover got to to the push-drive with a dive
tucked in front of square leg for a single
right on that off stump, tightly blocked towards extra cover
leading edge as he walks down the track, the ball rolls towards point
gets the single this time
gets on top of the bounce and solidly pushes off the back foot but straight to extra cover
tossed up fullish on off, turned to short midwicket
plays from the crease, this one turns in and he nudges it behind square leg, gets back for the second
not much turn but some bounce on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
pushed with the turn wide of midwicket off the front foot
sharp turn and bounce, but down the leg side as he misses the nudge
works a straightish one through square leg
slapped hard out to deep cover point
slower ball from Praveen, Bopara drops it practically at his own feet and somehow they manage a single. Good running
Praveen hits a length on off stump, the ball wobbling away through the air, and Bell defends to cover
Bell looks for the drop-and-run to cover once again, but the fielder is too quickly onto the ball
Praveen continues to keep it tight, nothing for Bell to work with  - not even any pace - and he can only tap it back down the wicket
Praveen loses his line a little with the final delivery, Bell chopping him down to third man for a couple
looped up on off stump, Bopara nudging the ball back down the track
Bopara bends right down into a premeditated paddle sweep, picking up a single for his troubles
flatter through the air from Ashwin, but a little short and Bell works with the spin to get the ball through square leg
a loopy flighted delivery is driven out to wide long off, Bopara finding enough space in the outfield to come back for the second
that is loose from Ashwin, and rightfully put away by Bopara, who cuts a short, wide ball to backward point
flicked off the pads, but stopped at midwicket
RP is full to start, and is driven out to the cover sweeper
shot! But good fielding too. Bopara punched it very hard through cover off the back foot, but Raina sprinted round the boundary in a flash to cut it off and get the ball back in to the keeper
on a length outside off, Bell is content to knock it away for a single
RP offers width outside off, but Bopara's cut finds point
just short of a good length outside off, and Bopara angles his bat for a single to third man
and Bell follows suit, jabbing down quite late to send the ball bouncing down to third man
he's a little short to start, and is easily cracked away by Bell
Jadeja gets excited as he spears one at the pads and Bopara bends to sweep, but that's hit the middle of the bat and racing down to fine leg for four
eased down to long-off
whipped down to long on, Bell staying deep in his crease
pitched up outside off, Bopara drives and a single is taken as the ball goes to long-off
a little flatter through the air from Jadeja, and Bell is cramped for room as he looks to force it through the off side
RP stays round the wicket to Bopara, who opens the face of the bat as he drives on the up, the ball going to point
slower one from RP, and Bopara is a little too early into his defensive poke
Bopara brings up England's 100 by stepping across and pushing a single to wide midwicket. A ripple of applause is heard around the ground
chopped down through gully, the fielder is a little tardy getting round and they're back for the second
nicely played by Bell, but he still gets only one for it as a late dab goes to third man
RP oversteps with what would've been the final ball of the innings, and Bell will have the chance to have a Free Hit
and he makes the most of it! A little short from RP and Bell steps back to club a pull in front of square, bisecting the boundary riders
tossed up very high by Jadeja, Bopara waits and waits and finally shovels a single to long-off
this was hardly short but Bell's footwork is lightning quick as he goes back and across to cut off the top of middle stump
nicely bowled by Jadeja, Bopara stepping back to defend
nurdled to midwicket, both keeper and bowler hare after the ball but neither can stop the single
driven back to the bowler, who fields in his follow through
Bell over-hits a drive, the ball taking the toe end and bouncing up off the pitch back towards Jadeja
flat-batted out to wide long-on
fuller from RP, Bell comes forward to drive to cover
good running, Bell spotting the chance for a single early and calling Bopara through
short and wide outside off, but there's cover out on the boundary so just one run the result
there's a touch more bounce than Bell was expecting on this one, but his dab into the off side still finds enough room for a single
full and quite wide, Bopara bends down low and drives square but picks out the fielder
eased down to long-on
full and straight, Bopara whips off the pads to square leg
much quicker and flatter through the air, the ball rushing on with the arm, and Bopara goes back to defend
good running, Bopara lunging down the track and placing the ball towards cover point with a defensive push
Bell steps onto the front foot to pick up a single to long-on
Bopara is a little cramped for room as he plays back, nudging with the spin to midwicket
he starts with a legcutter, which is punched to cover off the back foot
was he looking to play it this fine? I'm not sure, but four runs are the result. Bopara had set himself to run the ball to third man but it was more edge than face of the bat
a real slashing windmill of a cut sends the ball skimming down to third man
Bell walks across to off stump as Munaf delivers, but can't find the angle he was looking for and defends back to the bowler
craced off the back foot with a high left elbow, and the cover fielder cleans up
dinked to gully, Bopara calling Bell through for a sprinted single
tapped away for a single, the batsmen continuing to milk the bowling quite fluently
flicked into the leg side
again Bopara tries to work with the spin, but can't find space for a single
driven down to long-on off the front foot
edged! This was a genuine edge, but a thick one and Dhoni can't really be blamed. If there'd been a slip in place, Ashwin would've been in business. As it is, he's given away four runs
nudged back to the bowler
there's a hint of turn, Bopara cutting the ball to point
pushed back to the bowler off the back foot
a touch too much width offered outside off, Bopara steps back and away to slash a cut out into the deep
driven down the ground, another single to Bell's name
Bopara was ready and waiting in position for a premeditated paddle sweep as Jadeja delivered, a quicker one being glanced down to fine leg
short, wide, and Bopara misses out. His eyes lit up when he spotted this one, but he missed it after perhaps trying to make too much of the opportunity
worked with the spin into the leg side
flat and fast from Ashwin, Bopara stepping back and hitting to midwicket
swept down to fine leg
tossed up a little higher, Bell's defensive push going to midwicket
cracked back to the right of the bowler, but Ashwin gets across quickly and gets a palm to the ball to negate the single
Bell unfurls the reverse-paddle to pick the gap behind square on the off side, just the single though
the line on this was good but the length was just a little short. Bell spotted it in a flash, chopping a cut of fthe stumps after giving himself room
Bopara flings himself into a full-blooded drive, but hits extra cover
again extra cover is in action as he's pinged by another drive
three in three! And this time the fielder gets the crowd excited by throwing the ball up in the air. Definitely the bump ball. Raina is the man in that position
finally he does get the single, into the leg side
Bell comes down the track and is beaten in the flight but goes through with the shot, chipping to wide long on
a touch too straight from Ashwin, the spin takes the ball down the leg side and it's helped on its way by Bopara
fifty for Bell! Just the three fours, he's had to do a lot of running today, and fittingly the landmark comes up with a single to long-on
turned to short fine leg, the ball actually touching the pad rather than the bat
a whippy flick is stopped by the midwicket fielder
this time Bell does find the single on the leg side
paddle swept down to the man at fine leg, another one to the total
cracked hard to cover off the back foot
speared in towards middle, nudged away for a single
Bell gets across to off stump as Jadeja hones in on middle again, changing the angle and finding a single to midwicket

fifty for Bopara! And it's a superb shot to get him there. He had put himself into a position to play the paddle sweep but Jadeja sent a quick, flat ball down outside off. Bopara reacted well, twirling his wrists round and opening the face of the bat to get the ball to third man instead
nudged into space on the off side
and defended by Bell to end the over
Ashwin gives Bopara very little to work with, aiming full and straight, and the clip goes to midwicket
paddle-swept to fine leg
reverse sweep from Bell, who doesn't hit it that well but places it to the left of the short third man fielder
energetic fielding from Raina, as he saves a couple of runs diving to his right at midwicket
quick and flat outside off, Bell angling the ball away through gully
and turned into the leg side to end the over, Raina cleaning up again

the partnership is broken! Bell was looking so comfortable but he's just tried to do too much with this one. It was tossed up, on middle and off, and he came down the track and chipped an in-out drive over the covers ... or so it seemed. He actually hit it too well, as the ball carried out to wide long-off, where Manoj Tiwary - on as a sub - sprinted forward and to his left and clung onto a diving catch
Bopara just opens his wrists on the drive to place the ball through cover point, picking up a single
Stokes is off the mark straight away, staying deep in his crease and punching to extra cover
flighted outside off, and Bopara's drive is intercepted at extra cover
for the umpteenth time, Bopara uses the paddle sweep to pick up a single to fine leg
a little flatter from Jadeja, again Stokes waits on the back foot and a sliding stop from the midwicket fielder stops the single
predictably, the paddle sweep from Bopara and - spotting that it's RP Singh after the ball down there - he calls for the second
once again a paddle sweep, but RP has now come in much closer so it's just the one
flighted on middle, Stokes leans over it and pushes to midwicket
good fielding from the bowler, who dives across to his right to stop Stokes from getting off strike
Stokes comes forward in defence
flat and fast - the arm ball - and all Stokes can do is tap it to the midwicket fielder
Bopara is beaten, aiming a slashing, flat-footed cut towards point
this time he does find the single, with a less ambitious shot
pushed into the off side by Stokes
jabbed down to long-on
Stokes exposes all three stumps as Raina hurls down a quicker one, chopping the ball away at the last moment
again Stokes makes a little room, this time he finds space for a single

a boundary for Ben Stokes! He skipped down the track but was never to the pitch of the delivery. Nevertheless, he went through with the shot and not only hit it really well, but also found ideal placement to beat the cover sweeper

and he's gone next ball! Ashwin followed up with a much, much slower ball that just hung in the air. Stokes stepped forward and tried to work, against the spin, into the leg side, but the ball gripped, spun and took the leading edge, presenting the bowler with a very easy caught-and-bowled chance. India are taking control of this match.
Bresnan meets his first ball with a solid forward defence
that's anything but solid! Bresnan pushes forward very loosely, acres of space between bat and pad, and the ball turns in to take the inside edge but flies just past the leg stump
this time bat and pad are closer together as Bresnan defends
pushed to cover, and it's stopped by the fielder
the ball takes a thick edge of an attempted cut, but is stopped at short third man
driven hard down the ground

RP Singh! Bopara must've spotted that he had come in from the long-on boundary, as the batsman skipped down the track and slammed it in the air in that direction. Had RP been back on the rope, Bopara would've been out. Raina isn't happy. To be fair, RP was probably in to try and stop them taking two if the ball was hit along the ground
tapped away for one
driven down the ground, another single to the total
hints of a helicopter shot as Bopara sends the ball to long-on. Cheers from the crowd as RP fields down there
flight outside off, slow flight, Bopara walks across but cannot get it anywhere apart from back to Ashwin
the sweep has worked to day for him, gets it down to long leg
pushes firmly but there is nothing to work with, Ashwin fields
full on the pads this time, whipped in the air behind square leg
nudged in front of midwicket for another single
India are running through some tight overrs, BResnan gets behind this one turning in fullish but only pushes it straight back to Ashwin who has finished a controlled spell
stays beside the line to a length ball bouncing outside off but slaps the cut to point
takes a step outside the crease and drops this one in front of point for the single
straightish one on middle and leg, he stays back and nudges towards midwicket, open spaces out there
Bopara tries to break free, scythes this fullish one over the infield, but it drops short of sweeper cover
back of a length and he shuffles to whip it, there is a man in the deep in front of square leg
tries to line him up for the big shot, but Munaf follows him with the angle on a tight fullish length, squirted out to midwicket who dives and fires in the throw at the non-striker's
makes room, gets front foot out and slaps a fullish one on the bounce to extra cover
gets the paddle sweep wide enough of long leg to come back for the tight second run
there is no one at midwicket, but Tiwary from the deep has come running in to limit this work off the pads to one
pushes off the front foot wide of PK at sweeper cover, easy two
Bresnan smacks the sweep, right off the middle, to the deep square leg boundary, that will do for this over, one ball left

excellent running, and a brain fade from Jadeja gives England six off one ball, Bresnan was beaten in the flight but managed an awkward loft to long off, they took on the throw for the second, and Jadeja let loose towards the striker's end after gathering the throw from the deep
slaps a fullish one wide of long off who does well to get to his left to keep them to the single, and no wild throws this time
they are throwing all over the place, this time Virat from point has a shy, which goes way over the stumps as they take the single off a soft push
agile from Munaf, for once, he gets down quickly low to his right to stop a firm drive
neatly done, gliding this one from close to the body but Dhoni goes flying to his right to stop the ball
Munaf gets the yorker spot-on, nothing to be done with that, Bresnan calmly digs it out
now Munaf gets the left boot in the way of a furious scythe from Bresnan, that could have gone for more than one
Jadeja concedes the boundary first ball, nice way to start the over for England, shortish and he goes back to punch it well wide of sweeper cover
fuller one driven down to long off for a single
short again, he has PK at sweeper cover to thank for the effort JAdeja, else this cut was finding the boundary before PK got in the way with a desperate dive
gettting forward and nudging through midwicket
fires it in full outside off, he squeezes it in the air towards extra cover
cramping him for room, but it is a touch short and he can make some by rocking back and cutting to sweeper cover

and does his side a huge favour with rain approaching with a wicket first ball, the angle that worked so well on the last tour of England for him works again, angled in sharply in to the right hander on a length, he is pegged back, tries to run it down belatedly, misses, and RP uproots off stump
guides the widish one well but Tiwary at backward point goes leaping to his right to parry it away
Bopara walks down the track, and gives it his all, gets the slap wide of sweeper cover for a couple
gets the single with a firm push down to long off
Bopara goes screaming up the track in search of the single as Swann nudges to midwicket off the pad, there is no run there and he has to put in a huge dive back as the throw comes in
Swann keeps England on track with a squeezed couple between point and third man, the throw is on the stumps but Bopara is back
well bowled, slows it up on a full length, he gets the single with a push to point
gets across and whips the one angled in through midwicket which has been vacant for some time
drives firmly down to long on
Swann goes nowhere with the attempted chip shot, but that works for England, it falls between extra cover and long off, and they take the second
down the track he comes and pushes in the air, this time long on gets quickly to the ball
another pushed single in front of cover
slower one from Munaf, on middle and leg, nudged through midwicket
Swann takes a step down the track and drives, but it was very full from Munaf and he could not get much power on the shot, Munaf gets down and fields
now the short ball, but third man is short too, Swann is walking out and plays a delicate steer past that fielder, precious runs
low full toss, Swann goes for the drive, mid off is around to field
slower one from Munaf again, Bopara is chipping down the pitch and turns it softly through vacant midwicket,  they will come back for the second and go ahead on D/L
more midwicket from Bopara, another single with a firm clip off the pads
cannot connect but get enough off the pad on it to steal the single towards midwicket, RP hares after the ball and fires the throw, too late
angled in full on the pads, squirts towards square leg as he comes down the track, RP appeals, going down leg
midwicket continues to be productive for Bopara as he flicks for another single
there is the boundary, Swann has made some room and drilled the full delivery between extra cover and mid off, Munaf chases it all the way to the ropes
short ball now but Swann swings it through square leg, the man from deep midwicket bounds across, but slips even as he puts in the slide
RP goes for the yorker, Swann makes some more room and carves him between cover and point, not much on the shot this time though
gets outside leg and scythes the length ball from middle down to long on
full toss from Munaf now, Bopara turns it through midwicket for a single
walks down the track, Munaf drops it shorter, slower, Swann chips it softly towards midwicket, soft enough to bring two
makes room again for the big drive, Munaf goes full on the stumps, and Swann manages to squeeze it out to extra cover
Bopara walks down the track and works a length ball towards midwicket, this time long on charges in to keep him to one
Munaf serves up a low full toss, Swann exposes the stumps and carves him way over extra cover, in to the boundary, England cantering now
dot ball, oh well, a rarity, RP angles it in just short of a length, Bopara plays all around it and misses
too much with the angle on the pads, and tickled square for the single
sharp short ball, right in to Swann, who spots it late and just about gets the head down in time
in to the pads from a fuller length, Swann lines up to swing it over square leg, misses and it rolls away on the leg side
Bopara gets across and outside the crease, flicks a very full delivery, square leg puts in the slide to his right, single already taken
RP ends a fine over with another short ball in to Swann, who cannot get hold of the pull as he is not in the best of positions for the shot, squirts it infront of square leg
and then he chips down the track and dinks a fullish one in front of long on, bopara will scamper back for the second, Swann is such a combative presence to have at this moment
pushed in to the off side for a single
Munaf screams out the appeal, but this ball was headed well down leg as Bopara missed the swing

Munaf has run out Swann in pouring rain! drama at Lord's, Swann danced down the track, but could not get hold of this one, it trickled on to the pitch, Munaf charged for it even as England scampered for the run, got to the ball right under Swann's nose, wheeled around and fired in the throw at the non-striker's, he even hit

Munaf does it for India again, and Ravi Bopara falls at the doorstep of glory, it is Ravindra Jadeja who redeems himself at the deep midwicket boundary with a well-judged leaping high take, Bopara had bent the knee and swung Munaf high over midwicket, but found Jadeja, India are rejoicing in the huddle, they have come back from the brink, they had almost fallen off, a dejected Bopara has to walk back, tragic end to a brave innings
